attributes.action: Bring back National Service.
attributes.background: Nowadays, there are many ill-behaved young adults in the communities across the UK. National Service will not only correct the behavioural errors they make, but give them good incentive to do something good in their lives whilst in this military programme and get experience on military life.

attributes.action: Science is compulsory at GCSE. Make it an option.
attributes.background: Help young secondary students realise their potential and stop the stigma around academic subjects being "more necessary. "
attributes.additional_details: As a society we have advanced enough for there to be jobs in a variety of different industries. There are opportunities to go down career paths besides a scientific one. Creativity and individuality should be something we teach the youth of today, it's dissapointing that the education system has rules set in place that make students feel they aren't clever enough just because they are not as academically gifted as others. Science is compulsory, but wouldn't it seem wrong if Drama or Art was made compulsory at GCSE? Students are not shunned for "lack of creativity" so why should it be the other way around? Please sign this petition so the government may consider debating this.

attributes.action: Introduce 'reading dogs' to all primary schools in England
attributes.background: Research shows that children can get very stressed with reading aloud in class. Reading to dogs is a good way of stopping children feeling scared - dogs do not make comments or tell you off for getting things wrong and they always listen. All primary schools should have access to a 'reading dog.'
attributes.additional_details:
The Kennel Club already run a 'Bark and Read' scheme https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/barkandread 
Lane, H.B. & Zavada, S.D.W. 'When reading gets ruff: canine-assisted reading' The Reading Teacher 2013, 67(2) p. 87-95

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Increase the budget for crime and justice and hire more police to reduce crime
attributes.background:
Due to aggressive funding cuts and large decreases in the number of police officers during the coalition and Conservative governments, the crime rate has been rapidly increasing.

A lower budget means police cannot respond effectively to all threats due to a lack of resources such as riot gear.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2010, the number of police officers has decreased by almost 20,000, and Authorised Firearms Officers by 1,337, according to official statistics, alongside aggressive funding cuts of 18%. The number of police officers has decreased for eight years in a row.

This has caused a significant increase in crime recently, with the crime rate increasing by 10% in March 2016-17 and annual reports of violent crime doubling since 2012.

We need to increase the budget to stop this increase in crime.

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health services exempt from VAT.
attributes.background: Mental Health services such as Addiction Counselling (Food, Drugs, Alcohol etc), Psychotherapy and Trauma Counselling currently are all deemed as VATable expenses which makes them a “Luxury Item” this means that Thousands of people are having to pay extra for the help they desperately need!
attributes.additional_details: Currently services such as Equine Therapy, Art Therapy and Speech Therapy are all VAT Exempt so why not important potentially life saving/ changing services? If this government is serious about helping people with mental health issues then drop the VAT and help to make the services they need more affordable.

attributes.action: Stop the practice of charging self funding OAPs higher care rates than councils
attributes.background: Self funding residential care or nursing pensioners subsidise the fees for  council patients by hundreds of pounds per week for exactly the same care. All fees should be transparent and equal for all clients. Councils must pay more, private funders should pay the equivalent rate to ensure fairness.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Times Article:
https://www.ft.com/content/6c61fa30-f1dc-11e6-8758-6876151821a6

AGE UK report:
https://www.ageuk.org.uk/Documents/EN-GB/Press%20releases/behind_the_headlines_care_homes_oct2016.pdf?dtrk=true

Express Article:
https://www.express.co.uk/comment/expresscomment/723552/Wrong-sensible-savers-to-subsidise-care-elderly-old-age-saving-self-funding

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Exempt Commonwealth soldiers and veterans from paying fees for naturalization
attributes.background: Foreign commonwealth soldiers and veterans should be exempt from paying fees during naturalisation, life in the U.K. test, and language test as long as they have served for the minimum contract required and have qualified for the length of stay required.
attributes.additional_details: After serving in the British Army from commonwealth countries, you’re still required to undertake life in the U.K. test, language test and also pay the fee required for naturalisation. This is very sad after you have put your life on the line to serve in the queens army to defend the British well being.

attributes.action: The Government must fully protect the UK's fishing rights in talks with the EU.
attributes.background: Michael Gove “One of the things about leaving the EU is it means we’re free of the Common Agricultural Policy, free of the Common Fisheries Policy, able to have higher environmental and higher animal welfare standards." Mrs May.. “When we leave the EU, we will be leaving the Common Fisheries Policy.
attributes.additional_details:
From the Daily Express Newspaper. 

"EU officials appear to be targeting the UK’s fishing rights and want to use that as a bargaining chip in the talks in return for progress in other areas where Britain would require market access.

One unnamed EU diplomat told the Financial Times: “The UK government will ultimately need to decide how much it wants to pay to make the fish dream come true.”

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory dog licence In the UK
attributes.background: We all know in most cases it’s not the dog but the owner at fault. If you are happy to take on the responsibility of the care of a pet dog then you should not be adverse to paying a fair licence fee and being held responsible for the dogs actions.
attributes.additional_details: Let’s only permit responsible people to own dogs. How many times must we read stories of serious injuries or death, mistreated pets attacking adults, children or other dogs. Having adequate licence regulations in place would help weed out and ban future ownership of dogs belonging to people incapable of the task of raising a dog in a caring and responsible manner. If you are a caring dog lover then please support this petition to make life safer and kinder for both owners and dogs.

attributes.action: Ban smacking of children in England
attributes.background: Scotland and Wales are considering banning corporal punishment of children by their parents. Scientific evidence shows that smacking children is damaging. This form of discipline should no longer be legally allowed in England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/parenting/new-study-reveals-long-term-impacts-of-smacking-children/news-story/1d9cd66ef864f33feb38de4dd3e4da41

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/what-science-says-and-doesn-t-about-spanking/

attributes.action: Charge all Foreign Vehicles entering the UK
attributes.background: All Foreign Vehicles entering the UK to use our roads and motorways, to be charged a one year payment, and be issued a Vignette to register for their use of our road system.
attributes.additional_details:
If most of Europe can charge for their roads, it should be done in the UK, to help our economy, by extra revenue for maintaining our road infrastructure.
As an Island Nation we have the ideal opportunity, to charge at all Ports of entry.

attributes.action: Lest we forget! Fly Union Flag all year round to mark centenary of end of WW1
attributes.background:
Next year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to the fallen who made the ultimate sacrifice so we could be free, we believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings for the whole year.
attributes.additional_details:
At the going down of the sun and in the morning we will remember them.
Lest we forget.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have sprinklers in all schools in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Childrens lives are being put at risk because new schools or refurbished school since 2014 do not have to have sprinklers fitted
In Scotland and Wales it is mandatory so it should be the same for English and Northern Irish schools
attributes.additional_details:
The National Fire Chiefs Council believe all schools should be fitted as seen in this BBC article dated 25 October 2017
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41744582
The DfE's "expectation that all new schools will have sprinklers fitted", unless a school is "low risk" and installation "would not be good value for money".
Despite this, less than a third of the 260 schools built since 2014 under the Schools Building Programme have sprinklers

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged £140 for emergency consultation, to update the database £17 and admit the pet to hospital £200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled £702.04. A further £700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing £240. 
The total cost was £1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over £3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: More funding for students and single parents studying Foundation Degree Courses.
attributes.background: Students and single parents especially need more funding for studying Higher Education Courses. This can prevent financial hardship. Funding can enable a student to accomplish more goals, better prospects which helps completing their course. More funding should come from Student Finance.
attributes.additional_details: There is Foundation Degree Courses but different years of studying can prevent students from getting grants and bursaries. Grants and bursaries should be available for all Foundation Degree students on different years spent studying made available from Colleges, Universities and Student Finance. Funding can help students with buying books, travel cost, driving lessons and medical cost for sick children and young adults, and saving money for a rainy day.

attributes.action: Put aspects of gardening onto the Primary curriculum, teaching its benefits.
attributes.background: I introduced a motion on a similar topic at a Teachers' Conference last year, which gained much national publicity. Not all schools have a garden but all can do something in aa container or similar. Help can be given by the RHS Campaign for School Gardening and similar campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that outdoor learning can improve the mental health of particpants, and introducing children to New healthy foods can help to reduce obesity.

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the usa
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I myself am 27 and have never known my biological father and I am at an age where I would like my step father to be allowed to do so if he wishes.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the U.K. Government to condemn child sex trafficking in India.
attributes.background:
The Independent recently wrote an article about child sex trafficking in India and how big of an issue it is. The article highlighted just how big of a problem sex trafficking is in India. 
 
We urge the U.K Government to condemn this and urge the Indian government to take action.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to read more on the issue here is a link attached: https://breakthechainscampaign.wordpress.com/2017/12/08/sexual-exploitation/

attributes.action: Request HM government ask the Queen to issue Royal Pardon to Edith Thompson.
attributes.background: Edith Thompson was drugged and carried unconscious to the gallows in 1923 for a crime I believe she did not commit. My grandfather DI Scholes, acquired the letters she wrote to her lover Freddie Bywaters, which 'proved' her guilt. I do not believe they proved anything. I believe Edith was innocent.
attributes.additional_details: The prosecution sought to prove 'joint enterprise.' I do not believe they did. The jury was wrongly directed by the judge. The letters never incited Freddie to murder. I have read them all. The jury was made up of 11 men and just 1 women. There was no proof that Edith knew her lover, Freddie, would stab her husband that night. An independent witness also testified that she even begged him to stop. This is a terrible miscarriage of justice that has waited 94 years to be rectified.

attributes.action: Allow Walid Durani to stay permanently in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2012 Walid fled Afghanistan to the UK after his Grandfather was beheaded.  Walid was threatened with the same fate.  Since then he has been educated and completed an apprenticeship here. He was Highly Commended at the Youth Build UK awards that took place in Parliament in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
At the age of 18 the UK Government said he should be sent back to Kabul, Afghanistan. Walid has no family or support in Afghanistan and his life will certainly be danger. Kabul is an extremely dangerous place with the Foreign Office currently advising against all but essential travel & in some areas they advise against all travel.
His story has been covered by the BBC,various radio stations & newspapers.
Please help us support Walid by signing this petition. Follow us on facebook - Support Walid

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can’t intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Urge the Bank of England to stop using animal products in their bank notes
attributes.background:
The new 5 and 10 pound notes distributed contain animal product Tallow.

Tallow is a hard, fatty substance made from rendered animal fat, which is commonly used to make soap and candles.
attributes.additional_details:
As vegans, vegetarians, muslims, Hindus and people of planet earth, please sign!! This beyond ricidlous we have to stop using animals as an alternative to plastic or paper!! We can go noteless!!

The new polymer notes use beef tallow made from suet, which is hard fat found around an animal’s kidneys, stomach and other organs.

attributes.action: Stop the purchase of gas boilers and associated parts without a registration.
attributes.background: If the law stated, that selling and buying both domestic and commercial Gas, Oil and LPG boilers and associated parts, without governing body registrations became law, the dangerous practice of unqualified and dangerous installations would cease. Thus improving the safety for all and save lives.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look into the funding model and use of the NHS
attributes.background: The funding model of the NHS has been a political football for decades, yet it is perhaps the more fundamental of services. Its funding is too important to be decided by the conflicting interests of political parties. It's use needs to be examined to decide whether its current use is sustainable

attributes.action: Make broadcasters have content warnings and signpost support for mental illness
attributes.background: While some depictions of people's battles with mental illness in the media can oftentimes be accurate representations and this should be applauded it should also be done safely taking potential risks to the viewer/listener into account by offering warnings before the programme and signposting after.
attributes.additional_details:
Great strides have been made by some TV broadcasters to raise awareness of mental illness by depicting it so accurately, and some broadcasters exemplify how such a sensitive topic should be handled.

However I have noticed how web-based broadcasters offer no warnings of content and offer no signposting after the programme. 

This is potentially dangerous and I feel strongly that people who are vulnerable should be able to enjoy these programmes but know where to find help if needed afterwards.

attributes.action: Increase the Speed Limit on motorways between 11pm and 6am to 80 mph for cars.
attributes.background: During the night the motorway network is used less. Vehicles are now much better equipped with safety features to travel faster. Increasing the speed limit at night will encourage more travelling at this time and less congestion during the day. It would promote quicker and safer travelling at night.
attributes.additional_details: The National Speed Limit of 70mph on motorways was first introduced on a trial basis in 1965 and became permanent in 1967. The current 70mph limit has now been in place for over 50 years.

attributes.action: Waive the two child cap on tax credits for mothers working minimum 18 hours/week
attributes.background: After April 2017, no woman will be able to claim or receive any Tax credits for a third child, unless the child is born as a multiple birth or conceived as a result of a sexual assault. This approach is callous, as well as ignorant, as many women live with men that force them to get pregnant.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government deems third babies a luxury not every family has earned, though the royal’s third baby will be taken care of, courtesy of the TAXPAYER (who's being penalised the same as those who do not work at all).
As long as a woman is in paid work, she should be able to receive tax credit support.
For each child conceived, I believe 6 hours of work is ideal - e.g: 18 hours for 3 children, 24 hours for 4 children, 30 hours for 5 children.
A cap on 5 children (with the exception of one multiple birth of twins) is fair.
If a working mother falls ill or disabled as an unforseeable result, I believe her claim for tax credits should continue. However, a cap should be placed on any children following her illness, unless she is able to return back to work.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: Air travellers: punish drunken and/or violent and/or threatening behaviour.
attributes.background: To apply within the confines of an airport, or on board an aircraft (especially where this threatens the safety of the aircraft, crew or passengers).  A mandatory 2-year ban from flying with any airline operating flights from the U.K., 5 years for a second offence, a life ban for any third offence.
attributes.additional_details: People arrested for drunkenness on planes has doubled in the last year.

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Make Government spending transparent, adjust funding "increases" for inflation
attributes.background: Often funding increases are announced, which amount to a funding cut after inflation. The only transparent approach is to deflate figures for inflation to give an increase figure in "real terms".
attributes.additional_details:
Full Fact provides evidence that the Grant review for police funding amounts to a cut after inflation.
https://fullfact.org/crime/police-funding-england-and-wales/

Conservatives say Labour voted against an increase.
https://www.facebook.com/conservatives/photos/a.288165009278.146725.8807334278/10155780194029279/?type=3&theater

Labour say Conservatives voted for a real terms cut.
https://www.facebook.com/labourparty/posts/10155283147077411

attributes.action: Introduce new opportunities for medically failing applicants for the military.
attributes.background: Applicants who have applied and had their heart set on starting a military career with the correct attitude, fitness and skills who are turned away for, in some cases, minor or none apparent disabilities or injuries should be given more opportunities or choices.
attributes.additional_details: The modern military is diverse and equal such as allowing women to fight on the front lines but the the fact that you may not be allowed to serve on the front lines or for your country in any role due to a predicted adherent or minor issue has affected the majority of applying citizens. I understand that the military is required to uphold certain standards and a minimum level of fitness, qualities and skills from it's personnel depending on the various roles. However, when a potential candidate is not given the chance to prove their usefulness, or given any chance of finding their place in the military things need to changed or at the very least looked into.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wild caught species in the pet trade
attributes.background: Reptiles and fish are the most affected. 100s species of fish have gone extinct over the last 100 years because of the pet trade as they have been taken from their homes. It’s the same with reptiles, invertebrates and mammals.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine being a tortoise living in the desert and one day someone comes, puts you in a cage, ships you off to somewhere you don’t know and before you know it you are behind glass, ready to be sold to people -  many of whom don’t treat their pets right . Many animals die in the transportation from their homes to the pet shop . Fish are caught using cyanide, divers spray it on the coral reef to paralyse the fish then catch them and take them to be exported worldwide. This is wrong it needs to end.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: Increase the hourly funding rate for Early Years Education
attributes.background:
Early Years Funding is in Crisis!

National Living Wage is increasing by 4.4% in April.  Employer pension contributions are increasing to 2% at the same time.
Guess how much our funding has gone up by?
0%

Early years providers are closing, please sign and save FREE Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details:
We have to sign a contract stating it is ILLEGAL for us to get parents to pay top ups to cover the short fall in funding.  Not that they should of course, as the government advertise it as FREE childcare after all!

No other business has what it can charge their customers dictated to them.  The government control what we receive and what we can charge and the result is a deficit for most providers.

Please help is get an increase in funding, in line with the increase of business costs.

attributes.action: Don't put down Army dogs because they can't be re-homed. We owe a duty of care
attributes.background:
Two hero Army dogs which helped save thousands of lives on duty in Afghanistan are to be put down because they can't be re-homed, it has been reported.
Ex soldiers and dog handlers who worked with the Belgian Shepherds are said to have written to a Defence chief demanding the decision be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
“This is such a cruel way to treat these animals that have given us so much.
“People who worked closely with these dogs are devastated at the plans — they’ve begged to save them all.
"Experienced handlers have come forward to say they want to house the much-loved dogs, who have helped save hundreds of lives. 
In 2012, The Mirror reported how 807 of our much-loved military dogs had been destroyed by the Army over the past decade despite years of faithful service.
Daily Mirror online 1/12.17

attributes.action: Fund the costs spent by the emergency services following the Manchester attack.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to honour its commitment to fully fund the costs spent by the emergency services and local authorities following the horrific Manchester attack.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks after 5th November.
attributes.background:
I appreciate that Bonfire Night is going to be celebrated each and every year with fireworks, without fail. However, a lot of people and animals become extremely distressed during this time. 
Fireworks going on for weeks after Bonfire Night is completely unnecessary.

attributes.action: Update the driving licence point system from 12 points to at least 15-20
attributes.background: The points system was introduced in 1988 which is nearly 30 years ago. There are so many things you can get points for these days that were not about then. All I'm asking is for the people that are at say one more defective tyre or something away from an automatic ban because of the tot up.
attributes.additional_details: It should still be an instant ban for drink, drug driving. There are more and more ways now to get points than there was when this was introduced.
